resource.chars:
their notice and they themselves 
attended to the irksome labour 
of registering the indications of 
the instruments and calculating 
the mean results. Whoever 
will take the trouble of ex
amining these faithful and 
laborious records must come 
to the conclusion, that this 
branch of Natural Knowledge 
not only has not made any 
progress since the unfortunate 
dissolution of this society but 
has seriously retrograded in 
all that regards both the 
accuracy of the instruments 
of research and the proper 
method of pursuing this 
investigation.
From the immense repository
